definitions.text: the property of a body that causes it to have weight in a gravitational field
(often followed by `of') a large number or amount or extent
examples: he made a mint on the stock market
see the rest of the winners in our huge passel of photos

definitions.text: an ill-structured collection of similar things (objects or people)
(Roman Catholic Church and Protestant Churches) the celebration of the Eucharist
a body of matter without definite shape

examples: separate the warriors from the mass

definitions.text: the property of something that is great in magnitude
examples: it is cheaper to buy it in bulk
he received a mass of correspondence

definitions.text: a musical setting for a Mass
examples: they played a Mass composed by Beethoven

definitions.text: a sequence of prayers constituting the Christian Eucharistic rite
join together into a mass or collect or form a mass
examples: Crowds were massing outside the palace

definitions.text: formed of separate units gathered into a mass or whole
examples: aggregate expenses include expenses of all divisions combined for the entire year
